attributes.action: Repeal the 1955 canal closure act.
attributes.background: Repeal the 1955 canal closure act.To prevent losing more of our Industrial Heritage.And stop developers building on disused canals and surrounding heritage.This will also give restoration groups the possibility of restoring derelict Canals.
attributes.additional_details: Without this act being repealed ,we cannot stop any Local authorities or CRT applying for a canal closure and granting planning permission on derelict canals or nearby heritage sites.

attributes.action: Review unfair proposals to allocation of funding of selective schools in Torbay.
attributes.background:
The proposed National Funding Formula for Schools will be a drop of around 3% to the 3 selective schools in Torbay. 

The proposals, if implemented, will seriously endanger the ability of the school to maintain the outstanding education provided to the students and the results they achieve.

attributes.action: Build a relief road for Buxton, Derbyshire
attributes.background: Whenever Fairfield Road in Buxton has roadworks or if an accident occurs, the Town is crippled. We need a relief road or bypass to stop the build up of traffic that happens regularly and needs to be addressed.This is a major through route and is not suitable for the volume of traffic it serves

attributes.action: Petition  requesting Government  not  to apologise for the Balfour Declaration
attributes.background: This opposes a current  Petition requesting an apology which has been created. If there is anything to apologise for it is the failure of the UK Government to implement  it in full after 1933.  The other Petition ignores the fact that the Declaration was unanimously adopted by the League of Nations.
attributes.additional_details:
The Treaty of San Remo gave the Declaration the force of International Law.

The Champion of Arab Independence Col TE Lawrence approved of it.

attributes.action: Help stop the suffering in Syria
attributes.background: We ask the UK Government to use its international powers to end the deliberate targeting of civilians and civilian infrastructure in Syria, negotiate access routes with Turkey and other countries which could help for medics and medical supplies to Syria.

attributes.action: Consider making the state visit of Donald Trump as grand as possible.
attributes.background: Donald Trump has clearly stated that he wants to build on the special relationship between the US and UK, which is one of the great forces in history for justice and peace. Our countries share a deep bond military, financial, cultural and political. We should make this the grandest state visit ever.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.standard.co.uk/news/politics/donald-trump-hails-usuk-special-relationship-as-he-welcomes-theresa-may-to-the-white-house-a3452096.html

attributes.action: Stop the sale of armed forces barracks . Save our home and our heritage.
attributes.background: The closure of Sir John Moore Barracks our home our history and the county's heritage is being bulldozed to make way for affordable housing. The light infantry association members believe the barracks can be used for multi purpose venue for our wounded injured homeless personnel.
attributes.additional_details: Please see the list of objections held at the Shrewsbury Town Council. Also see the objections sent direct to Defence Secretary Michael Fallon .

attributes.action: Develop a train service from Sheerness to Leysdown
attributes.background: The isle of Sheppey has recently seen a huge development in Neatscourt retail park near Queenborough, but the infrastructure has not been developed to allow residents from perhaps Leysdown to access it. If there was a train with multiple stops across the island, people would access its shops easier.

attributes.action: Form a Select Committee on the causes of the recent rise in xenophobic behaviour
attributes.background: Police report that hate crimes have increased substantially since the EU referendum, which has been taken by some to legitimise racist & xenophobic activity. Politicians of all parties must work together to oppose this, and avoid encouraging such behaviour with careless statements and actions
attributes.additional_details: A  Select Committee should provide an opportunity for politicians to consider whether (inadvertently or not) their statements and actions have contributed to the present deplorable situation. It should also focus on exposing those elements of the media which are peddling misinformation and fostering hatred. Members of Parliament, working across party lines, should develop strategies to oppose racism and xenophobia and demand effective action from the Government.

attributes.action: Revoke the BBC's charter and privatise the company.
attributes.background: The BBC has become increasingly biased in its news coverage and is now a political pawn. In particular, with its pro-EU stance, the BBC does not represent more than half the country. However those who it does not represent are nonetheless legally bound to pay the licence fee.

attributes.action: Request Government to publish expected pros & cons/Business Case for leaving EU
attributes.background: The detailed plan for Brexit and new trade discussions are confidential, so nobody else can reliably forecast the impact Brexit will have over the next 10 years in terms of immigration levels and key economic measures. The Government forecasts should therefore be published as soon as possible.
attributes.additional_details:
It is usually OBR's responsibility to produce these forecasts, but due to lack of disclosure of all relevant information are unable to do so. 
Immigration levels and the economic/statistical information typically provided in the OBR's Economic and Fiscal Outlook reports should be provided.
Should Government feel negotiations will be prejudiced by revealing this information; they should commit to providing it as soon as feasible and certainly 3 weeks before final vote on Brexit terms take place.

attributes.action: I call for a vote of NO CONFIDENCE in this government!
attributes.background: Brexit is causing chaos to the United Kingdom and it's citizens, it is clear, the referendum as presented to the voter was based on lies and exagerations and the government is still continuing this trend, this must stop.
attributes.additional_details: Not allowing parliment to vote on when article 50 will be presented, nor allowing the majority of the United Kingdom to have a rethink, now that they know the real implications of the result of the advisory referendum.

attributes.action: Introduce a register of people who are convicted of animal cruelty
attributes.background: In light of the recent conviction for animal cruelty I am requesting the UK government to introduce a register to list the people who have been convicted and are banned from keeping animals. This would make enforcing and monitoring these bans more efficient

attributes.action: Jeremy Hunt MP & Lord O’Shaughnessy: Remove Big Pharma Influence over MHRA
attributes.background:
The MHRA is funded by the Department of Health for the regulation of  medical devices, whilst the costs of medicines regulation is met through fees from the pharmaceutical industry.

The MHRA must become independent and entirely funded through public money as well as showing more transparency.
attributes.additional_details:
The MHRA is the government body which licenses medicines in the UK. It's been criticised for its links with big pharmaceutical companies, whose financial interest is to promote their expensive products and limit cheaper and effective alternatives.

The MHRA doesn't allow the public to be involved in the implementation as a transparent process of drug licensing with public access to pharma companies' data is lacking. 

We want the secrecy to end and see financial dependency on pharma removed!

attributes.action: Make all schools in England call transgender students by their chosen pronouns
attributes.background: In some secondary schools in England it states in their gender policy that all transgender students should be allowed to be referred to by their chosen pronouns and name. However this is unfortunately not the case in all schools across England.
attributes.additional_details: As somebody who is directly affected by this lack of law and know many other young people in similar situations at school, who have all felt just how devaluing it is to have this basic right refused to us. I believe it is essential that all transgender students are safe to feel respected and valued in our secondary schools across England.

attributes.action: Ensure carbohydrate values are available in all premises serving food
attributes.background: My son has type 1 diabetes and controls this with insulin injections. Insulin requirements are calculated dependent upon carbohydrates in food, sadly we have found this information is not available in all food premises. Without this information available he is at risk of fitting.
attributes.additional_details:
If too much or too little insulin is provided, type one diabetics are at risk of potentially life threatening fits. Type 1 diabetes is a autoimmune disease and can not be controlled by diet. 
Please help those suffering from this horrible condition to lead as normal a life as possible.

attributes.action: Make Small council-maintained schools exempt from the Apprenticeship Levy.
attributes.background:
The Apprenticeship Levy, being introduced in April, will see all businesses including schools with a wage bill over £3 million a year contributing 0.5 per cent of that wage bill to fund new apprenticeships. 
Small schools are being treated unfairly and this needs to be reviewed!
attributes.additional_details:
Small schools with a smaller wage bill that are maintained by the LA will also be expected to pay the Levy and will need to account for this in their separate small school budgets. 
Academies and faith schools are exempt from this - small schools are being treated unfairly, and their already struggling budgets are surely taking the hit!

attributes.action: Have the A1 & A2 Motorcycle Licence automatically upgrade after 2 years
attributes.background:
Upgrade the A1 to a A2 after 2 years.
Upgrade the A2 to a full licence after 2 years.
Why? 
car drivers can drive a vehicle with any power after one test, why can't us bikers?
At least with 2 years experience of each licence, surely that is enough experience to be given the privilege to move up?
attributes.additional_details: Bikers must complete a CBT test for a 125. Then another test for the A1 licence that is for a 125 AGAIN. what consists of a theory test, a module 1 and a module 2, and then they have to wait to be older anyway to go for the A2 licence what again consists of a module 1 & a module 2 , then for the full A licence they must do ANOTHER! module 1 and module 2 test, and to prepare for the tests, training is needed consisting at least 5 lessons costing a bomb! and takes up alot your time. It's over kill

attributes.action: Stop the funding cuts to SEN schools and protect our specialist education
attributes.background: Many specialist education schools are having funding cut, with future cuts also happening. As a result, classrooms are being closed and staff are being made redundant. This area of education is already under so much strain through lack of funding and will reach crisis point unless the cuts stop!!

attributes.action: Urgently increase the penalty for illegal fly tipping.
attributes.background: Incidents of large scale illegal fly tipping are occurring far to frequently and the fly tips are almost on an industrial scale, especially in rural areas. It is obvious to all that organised criminals have become involved and are profiting from fly tipping.
attributes.additional_details: There is no doubt that the crime of fly tipping is having a serious effect on the countryside, wildlife and communities - it can't be allowed to go on.

attributes.action: Make Statutory Maternity Pay 90% of average weekly earnings for 39 weeks
attributes.background: My husband and I are parents to a wonderful little girl named Daisy. We would love to have another child. Unfortunately, we know we will never be able to afford it with maternity pay being so low, i.e. £139.58 a week or less. Please support working parents
attributes.additional_details:
At the moment, statutory maternity pay (SMP) is paid for up to 39 weeks. You get: 
- 90% of your average weekly earnings (before tax) for the first 6 weeks 
- £139.58 or 90% of your average weekly earnings (whichever is lower) for the next 33 weeks

attributes.action: Proscribe the extremist group Britain First
attributes.background: Far right propaganda on the internet and social media is all pervasive. Britain First's Facebook page reaches and influences millions a week. The Govt must proscribe Britain First .
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/entry/britain-first-muslim-elected-officials_uk_574352c4e4b0e71ef36d9617?edition=uk&b52pke8u54myousor

http://www.politics.co.uk/news/2014/06/19/britain-first-the-violent-new-face-of-british-fascism

These are just 2 of many links showing just how dangerous Britain First are.

attributes.action: Screening age for bowel cancer to be reduced from 60 to 50 in England.
attributes.background: Early diagnosis (Stage 1) offers a 97% survival rate. Without screening, the majority of patients between 50 & 59 may not be diagnosed until a later stage through their GP / AE. Cancer is more difficult to treat if diagnosed at a late stage (Stage 4) their survival odds could be as little as 7 %
attributes.additional_details:
BOWEL CANCER IS THE UK SECOND BIGGEST CANCER KILLER.

Reducing the screening age save lives it could also deliver substantial savings to the public purse. Treatment costs for a bowel cancer patient diagnosed at Stage 1 averages £3,373 as opposed to £12,519 for a patient diagnosed at Stage 4.

attributes.action: Make the pay increase for new prison officers a national offer!
attributes.background: The government have increased new prison officers pay on Fair & Sustainable contracts to be inline with old officers pay in the south east! This is a divide & conquer tactic and should be rolled out across all fair and sustainable officers nationally! It is a national service!
attributes.additional_details: The prison service is in crisis. The service hasn't seen a pay rise in years and due to increased pension contributions, has actually seen staff have pay cuts and earn less than they did 10 years ago. The current imbalance on pay means new officers earn 5 thousand pounds less than old terms and condition officers, for doing the same job, the most dangerous in this country, except in the south east! It's a national service with national pay, all grades should be equal and increased inline with inflation, nationally.

attributes.action: Get involved in Nnamidi Kanu case considering that he is also a British citizen.
attributes.background: Nnamidi Kanu has been unjustly detained by Nigeria government for almost 2 years. The issue is now beyond a young man fighting for the freedom of his people but that of violation of his fundamental human right in several occassions. Injustice to one is injustice to all!!

attributes.action: Let the UK Public Vote on the final Brexit deal
attributes.background: On 23rd June 2016, the U.K. decided to Leave the European Union. Whilst it is down to the government to get the best possible deal for a Post-EU Britain, the public should be allowed to have a vote on the final deal.
attributes.additional_details: Whilst it is down to the government to get the best possible deal for a Post-EU Britain, the public should be allowed to have a vote on the final deal, as many people voted to Leave for various reasons, as well as there being many policies those who voted for Remain liked about the EU, so this will ensure that the majority of the UK is in favour of the final Brexit deal and that it benefits all those in our country, regardless of how they voted in the referendum.

attributes.action: Introduce legislation to protect officers tackling motorbike & auto crime
attributes.background: Police officers have high levels of training in pursuit driving & tactical resolutions yet are afraid to use tactics i.e. Stop stick on motorbikes. There is no protection in law if something goes wrong and an offender is hurt. Motorbikes fail to stop regularly, commit crime & police can't pursue.
attributes.additional_details: Many crimes are carried out on motorcycles, robberies, shootings & drug dealing. Police wont pursue in case the criminals hurt themselves & officers are scared to use stop stick in case the criminal gets injured & they get blamed. Recent incidents in Merseyside have seen up to 60 motorbikes causing mayhem at one time, many on stolen bikes, riding on pavements, through red lights etc. Legislation is needed to protect officers so they can tackle this problem effectively & put blame on offenders.

attributes.action: Make heart screeening a standard procedure at your 20 week scan!
attributes.background: We recently lost our son at 4 weeks old due to an undiagnosed heart condition, hypertrophic obstructive cardiomyopathy. This wasn't picked up until he was 2 weeks old. Nothing was picked up through pregnancy and he was rushed into intensive care on his 1 day check up.. more needs to be done!
attributes.additional_details: We have done research and spoke to many families. This heart condition can be picked up in pregnancy as can many other conditions, but have found out if you want a heart scan you currently have to pay.. I have had 3 children before and no problems so I didn't think I would have to this time round. Our son fought hard for 4 weeks, a stroke, infections and then we had to say goodnight. More training needs to be given to those doing the scans.. no one should have to go through this.

attributes.action: Hold a second EU referendum on the grounds that demographics have now changed.
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, would like to request that a second referendum on the United Kingdom's membership of the EU should be held, due to the indication that demographics are now likely to have changed across the UK and many voters regret their decision on June 23rd.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/brexit-poll-majority-uk-remain-eu-theresa-may-article-50-second-referendum-latest-a7395811.html%3Famp?client=safari

http://uk.businessinsider.com/brexit-vote-regret-leave-margin-victory-2016-10

attributes.action: Deliver much needed aid to Somaliland
attributes.background:
Whilst severe drought in Somaliland continues the UK has the ability to provide the aid needed to help save those that are struggling to survive in Somaliland.

People are starving to death in Somaliland and are suffering from drought. Let us be the ones to feed them.
attributes.additional_details:
Their message to the world is: "Without help now, we'll all be finished.'
Please see below for more information:


http://www.itv.com/news/2017-03-08/somaliland-drought-victims-plea-without-help-now-well-all-be-finished/

http://www.itv.com/news/2017-03-07/will-the-world-heed-warnings-of-somalilands-savage-drought/

attributes.action: Election Manifestos of political parties must become legally binding contracts
attributes.background: The Parties publicly declare their policies that they promise to deliver if elected into office this is the Election Manifesto. There is no legal mechanism in place besides general/local elections to hold parties to account. Election Manifestos should be made into legally binding contracts.
attributes.additional_details:
If a elected government, local council, elected mayor or assembly breaks the contract they've delivered to the electorate. The party in question should be taken to the British Courts if found guilty the punishment should be a fine the payment would be from the parties own funding and not from the tax payer to deter uk parties from purposefully deceiving the electorate.
 
https://www.theguardian.com/notesandqueries/query/0,,-203998,00.html

http://www.thefreedictionary.com/Electoral+manifesto

attributes.action: Save Lives by regulating extreme sporting activities
attributes.background: We lost our daughter Kleyo in an nightmare incident that could have easily been prevented. Please help us to enable extreme sports seekers to have a safe adventure. Help petition our MPs and Government to work with other EU member states to tackle unregulated and unskilled operators.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.google.co.uk/search?q=kleyo+de+abreu&oq=kleyo+de+abreu&aqs=chrome.0.69i59.8717j0j8&sourceid=chrome&ie=UTF-8

attributes.action: Tv advertisment to raise awareness on using country roads #ThinkCountryside.
attributes.background: There are a increasing number of incidents involving horses and cyclists on our country roads. A Tv advertisement will help raise awareness in educating communities on the dangers of blind bends. Detailed examples on How to pass horses and cyclists safely on the country roads.
attributes.additional_details: An Educational TV advertisement is the way forward in educating all road users to help reduce accidents and fatalities.

attributes.action: Restoration of Right of Appeal on Immigration Applications of Elderly Parents
attributes.background: That right of Appeal has been taken away from all immigrants including children, elderly people and the infirm. We demand that appeal rights be restored in order for the fair, open and democratic Legal system in this country. Elderly parents are the most adversely affected category.
attributes.additional_details: Before current Immigration Rules and Policy Guidance an automatic right of appeal existed for refusal of immigration cases. The Home Office’s refusal decision could further be challenged in a Court of Law (Tribunal) and an immigrant could put his/her case forward to an Immigration judge. But not any more! The Government has replaced it with something called an ‘Administrative Review’ – which basically means you have no right of appeal before an independent judge.

attributes.action: Give all ancient woodland statutory legal protection
attributes.background: Ancient woodland is recognised as irreplaceable due to the specialised plant and animal species they support, not found elsewhere. As a result of habitat loss and fragmentation over the last 50 years 60% of those specialised species have declined significantly according to the State of Nature Report
attributes.additional_details: Ancient woodlands are a vital part of our cultural heritage, often containing archaeological remains waiting to be discovered, yet 85% of it has no legal protection. If we are to commit to our climate, flood alleviation and biodiversity action plan obligations these habitats must be protected from vandalism and development. At one time woodland covered the majority of the UK, as relics of this wild wood we must ensure that our ancient woodlands survive for the benefit of future generations.

attributes.action: Change Family Court Orders regarding Parental Alienation.
attributes.background:
Family Court Orders to automatically state: "Neither parent should cause intentional Parental Alienation including Psychological Manipulation & Isolation of Parental Responsibilities"

Parental Alienation has huge effects on children IE: Their education, mental, emotional state & causes anxieties.
attributes.additional_details:
This would exclude: Domestic Violence or if an Injunctions in place

What's Parental Alienation? 
It is the Psychological Manipulation of young children & isolation of a Parents Responsibilities. PR Example: Schooling, Health, Religion, General decisions on bringing up of the child.

Many parents that take their child's legal guardian to court & leave to find they have the same issues. Adding this to court orders would resolve this PA issue.

More info: parentalalienation.webs.com

attributes.action: To investigate the shortcomings of the Continuing Health Care assessment process
attributes.background: In the UK thousands of people are being denied what they feel is their rightful or their relatives rightful entitlement to CHC funding.  We feel that this urgently needs reviewing, especially for those suffering multiple medical needs from symptoms of dementia & other serious illnesses.
attributes.additional_details: The Decision Support Tool, in its current form, we feel does not take into account the complexities, uniqueness and unpredictability of many serious illnesses. There are many examples of people who are seriously ill & require full time nursing care, yet are being denied funding. We believe that the entire process requires thorough investigation, with straightforward guidelines, eligibility criteria & grading structure put into place.

attributes.action: Make it illegal not to allow LGV drivers access to welfare facilities at RDC's
attributes.background: There are thousands of HGV/LGV drivers who on a daily basis are denied access to toilet and washing facilities at some major distribution centres in the U.K. despite the fact that they could be stuck there for a number of hours. I believe that this contravenes our human rights and should be illegal

attributes.action: Halve UK Foreign aid and spend the £7 billion saved on the NHS
attributes.background: It is time that our elected members of parliament listened. It is wrong to spend money abroad whilst our own people are not being treated in the NHS

attributes.action: Make it compulsory all authorities scan all domestic pets!
attributes.background: Bodies working in the animal sector, such as vets & shelters, usually scan for a microchip. However this is not compulsory and there are other authorities who will not scan at all such as a number of councils. All authorities working with animals, by law, should be required to scan all domestic pets
attributes.additional_details:
Microchips in domestic pets were introduced so, should an animal be lost or found injured, an owner could be located and notified. 
There is no current legislation which states any authority who comes in to contact with animals has any legal obligation to scan them. 
Dogs and cats can be collected & disposed of by councils without having been scanned and owners will never be informed. This leads to great distress and upset when the owner has a right to be informed of the fate of their companion

attributes.action: Award QTS as part of EYITT
attributes.background: EYITT's have to meet the same entry requirements and the same set of rigorous standards as their counterparts who achieve QTS.
attributes.additional_details:
Without QTS, EYT's have found that they do not receive equal stature, pay or recognition for the demanding work that they carry out and their dedication, passion and commitment towards the teaching profession and children and families aged 0-5.

http://www.nurseryworld.co.uk/nursery-world/news/1159248/early-years-pay-and-conditions-survey-2016

https://getintoteaching.education.gov.uk/eligibility-for-teacher-training

attributes.action: Osseointegration for NHS patients
attributes.background: Osseointegration is for a metal implant anchored in to the bone to all prosthetic limbs to be surgically attached. This will vastly improve people's lives. Current the U.K. Government will not fund this. This has to change
attributes.additional_details: Dr kang at the royal free hospital advised me the only way the operations would go ahead is by people pressuring government to allow funding for these operations. Join me in making this a reality and improving so many people's lives

attributes.action: Call for a general election
attributes.background: Theresa May does not deserve or have the capacity to be the prime minister. She was not voted for by the people and her decisions are detrimental to the whole country, a general election must be held for the country to decide who is best to lead us through these dark times..

attributes.action: Allow British citizens the same rights to live with families as EEA nationals
attributes.background:
To bring a partner or spouse in the UK, British citizens have to show income of at least £18,600 or more if they have children a rule which does not apply to settled Europeans living in the UK 

EU nationals living in the UK are allowed to bring in spouses and families from anywhere in the world.
attributes.additional_details:
How is it possible that another EU citizen has more rights to family life than a British national in the UK? 

We ask for a change to these rules to give British citizens the right to have their spouses or partners live and work with them in the UK, without the income requirements. Also to be granted the 5 year residence card, as other spouses of EU nationals are entitled to, not the 30 months given to spouses of British citizens.

attributes.action: Investigate claims made by the CDC whistle blower regarding MMR and Autism
attributes.background: Alarming rise in numbers of autistic spectrum disorders after the MMR vaccine. Most recently a whistle blower 'William Thompson' who is a scientist working at the CDC in America has made claims that the link between autism and MMR vaccine has been covered up. Make our authorises investigate ASAP
attributes.additional_details:
Please see link for movie regarding the whistleblower http://vaxxedthemovie.com

Now see the facts - https://youtu.be/_KrpK0rbl9w

attributes.action: Make handfasting a legal ceremony
attributes.background: The tradition of handfasting has been practiced for thousands of years pre-dating any wedding ceremony concocted by any modern religion/faith. These have their marriages recognised by law and there is no good reason why this same right should not be extended to include Pagan faiths.
attributes.additional_details:
The Marriage (Scotland) Act 1977 made Pagan weddings and handfastings legal in Scotland, allowing Norse, Druids & other Pagans to obtain legally recognised marriage ceremonies in accordance with their faith, but at present Pagans in England & Wales do not have that right.
We request that the government recognise how important it is for people to be able to be joined in matrimony in accordance with their religious beliefs and give Pagan handfasting legal recognition in England and Wales without prejudice and without having to have a second ceremony to legalise the commitment.

attributes.action: Change sentencing guidelines for causing death by dangerous driving
attributes.background: We are trying to get the sentencing guidelines changed for causing death by dangerous driving.
attributes.additional_details:
On 2nd August 2015, Aiden Platt, was knocked off his motorbike and killed by a woman in a car.
The driver, was under the influence of 3 different drugs, when she sideswiped his bike.
On 23rd January 2017, the driver was given a 18 month suspended sentence and walked free. The judge ruled that because she had a 6 month old child, she should only be given a suspended sentence.
All this does, is sending a message to others, that it is OK to get into a car under the influence of drugs or alcohol

attributes.action: Make compulsory the labeling of Eggs from Caged Hens on all food products.
attributes.background: Many consumers are grateful for the opportunity to choose between purchasing free range eggs or those from caged hens. It is troubling, however, that most food products which contain egg don't specify if the eggs used are from Caged hens. This prevents consumers making an informed, ethical choice.

attributes.action: Label all halal products
attributes.background: By British law all food and products have to have a label on where the product has come from, whether it's meat or confectionery, so British people know where the product comes from and its health content, even in fast food restaurants and any restaurant.
attributes.additional_details: All fast food chains Burger King, KFC, Dominos, Subway, Mars, all confectionery, sweets, chocolate, all supermarkets that sell meat that's halal and no labels on them so the British people have the right to know where everything they buy comes from and about halal products.

attributes.action: Stop the disbandment of the British Army White Helmets Motorcycle Display Team.
attributes.background: They are a 30-strong display team from the Royal Corps of Signals and are being scrapped this year. They were Formed in the 1920s and have thrilled millions across the globe for decades with their daredevil displays – but the British Army is Axeing the White Helmets for being ‘out of date’.
attributes.additional_details:
The riders will be given new roles as recruiters by the end of the year, which has saddened many in the military. One White Helmets commander said: ‘It’s a great shame. 'Yet another piece of the Army’s heritage is being scrapped.’

Let's stop this madness - they are not out of date - they are a must for the British Army.!!!
